events.name: on-layout
events.description: Emitted when drawer toggles between occupying space on page or not

events.name: click
events.description: Emitted when user clicks/taps on the component and drawer is NOT in mobile mode; Useful for when taking a decision to toggle mini mode

events.name: mouseover
events.description: Emitted when user moves mouse cursor over the component and drawer is NOT in mobile mode; Useful for when taking a decision to toggle mini mode

events.name: mouseout
events.description: Emitted when user moves mouse cursor out of the component and drawer is NOT in mobile mode; Useful for when taking a decision to toggle mini mode

events.name: mini-state
events.description: Emitted when drawer changes the mini-mode state (sometimes it is forced to do so)

overlay.description: Puts drawer into overlay mode (does not occupy space on screen, narrowing the page)

mini-width.description: Width of drawer (in pixels) when in mini mode

mini-to-overlay.description: Mini mode will expand as an overlay

no-mini-animation.description: Disables animation of the drawer when toggling mini mode

breakpoint.description: Breakpoint (in pixels) of layout width up to which mobile mode is used

behavior.description: Overrides the default dynamic mode into which the drawer is put on

elevated.description: Adds a default shadow to the header

persistent.description: Prevents drawer from auto-closing when app's route changes

show-if-above.description: Forces drawer to be shown on screen on initial render if the layout width is above breakpoint, regardless of v-model; This is the default behavior when SSR is taken over by client on initial render

no-swipe-open.description: Disables the default behavior where drawer can be swiped into view; Useful for iOS platforms where it might interfere with Safari's 'swipe to go to previous/next page' feature

no-swipe-close.description: Disables the default behavior where drawer can be swiped out of view (applies to drawer content only); Useful for iOS platforms where it might interfere with Safari's 'swipe to go to previous/next page' feature

no-swipe-backdrop.description: Disables the default behavior where drawer backdrop can be swiped
